channel.title: Qbasic
channel.description: How do you convert 7bit binary to decimal in QBASIC?

item.title: Qbasic
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

SUB Bin2Dec COLOR 14: LOCATE 2, 30: PRINT "Binary to Decimal" COLOR 10: LOCATE 5, 20: PRINT "Enter a binary number (1's or 0's):"

DO: Bin$ = INKEY$ 'string number entry 1 or 0 with backspace
IF Bin$ = “1” OR Bin$ = “0” THEN Binary$ = Binary$ + Bin$
L = LEN(Binary$)
IF L > 0 AND Bin$ = CHR$(8) THEN Binary$ = MID$(Binary$, 1, L - 1)
COLOR 14: LOCATE 5, 57: PRINT Binary$; " "
LOOP UNTIL L > 0 AND Bin$ = CHR$(13) 'enter quits

FOR i = 0 TO L - 1
place = VAL(MID$(Binary$, L - i, 1))
dec = place * 2 ^ i
Decimal = Decimal + dec
NEXT
COLOR 11: LOCATE 10, 30: PRINT “Decimal number =”; Decimal

END SUB

Yes, it’s googled, I haven’t touched qbasic for a long time and dont wish to again

Read full topic

item.title: Qbasic
item.dc:creator: @bowserjr2 Bowser jr
item.description:
@bowserjr2 wrote:

[quote=“T4_, post:3, topic:282301”][quote author=kaisertm link=topic=373005.msg2814553#msg2814553 date=1244209164]
How do you convert 7bit binary to decimal in QBASIC?

[/quote]
8Bit? Also, BASIC is outdated and I doubt there will be many articles on this…[/quote]
No 7-bit, it is ASCII.
But it work like 8-bit just one less number.

0(*64)+ 0(*32)+ 0(*16)+ 0(*8)+ 0(*4)+ 0(*2)+ 0(*1)
And you get the decimal.

Read full topic
